ticket.title: Fix Failing "test_any_should_not_load_results"
ticket.original-body:
As mentioned on "this thread":http://groups.google.com/group/rubyonrails-core/browse_thread/thread/e5e8dfd7cf7a9c94 and on the comments of "this commit":http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/93e10f9911fb2a096681ee0a0bc82487a9a06c44#comments, there is a test which breaks if you have an older version of Mocha installed. Here's the message it gives.
@@@ 1) Failure: test_any_should_not_load_results(NamedScopeTest) [./test/cases/../../lib/active_record/test_case.rb:40:in `assert_queries' ./test/cases/named_scope_test.rb:189:in `test_any_should_not_load_results' ./test/cases/../../lib/../../activesupport/lib/active_support/testing/setup_and_teardown.rb:94:in `__send__' ./test/cases/../../lib/../../activesupport/lib/active_support/testing/setup_and_teardown.rb:94:in `run']: 0 instead of 1 queries were executed. <1> expected but was <0>. @@@
Attached is a patch which fixes this problem by not using Mocha.
